article.headline: Campbell 78, Florida Gulf Coast 62
article.story: BUIES CREEK, N.C. -- Jonathan Rodriguez scored 21 points and grabbed 11 rebounds to lead Campbell in a 78-62 win over Florida Gulf Coast on Wednesday night. It was the sixth double-double of the season for Rodriguez, who was the only player in double-digit scoring for the Camels (8-12, 5-6 Atlantic Sun Conference). Lorne Merthie scored all of his nine points for beyind the arc, going 3-for-3. Junard Hartley dished out eight assists. Kyle Marks and Chad Lutkenhaus led the Eagles (9-14, 5-7) with 12 points apiece. Campbell led by five points at the break, but opened the second half on a 22-4 run to clinch the victory. The Camels scored 27 points off 26 turnovers by the Eagles, and outrebounded Florida Gulf Coast 33-29.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
